a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Child death rates by cause for boys vs. girls in India, 2019
Child death rates are here measured as the number of deaths of children aged 1 to 4 years old per
100,000. This is shown in India for different causes of death in infant boys versus girls. Causes which lie
below the grey line have higher death rates in girls relative to boys.
Data source: IHME, Global Burden of Disease (2019)
